ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ قٓ وَٱلْقُرْءَانِ ٱلْمَجِيدِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: QAF. I CALL to witness the glorious Qur'an.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: By Qaf and the glorious Quran, (you are the Messenger of God).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Qaf; by oath of the Glorious Qur’an.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Qaf. I swear by the glorious Quran (that Muhammad is the Apostle of Allah)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Qaf. By the Qur'an glorious, We have sent thee as a warner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Qaf: By the Glorious Qur'an (Thou art Allah's Messenger).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Qaf. [These letters (Qaf, etc.) are one of the miracles of the Quran, and none but Allah (Alone) knows their meanings]. By the Glorious Quran.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:1] Qāf: God knows best what He means by this [letter]. By the glorious Qur’ān, [by] the noble [Qur’ān], the disbelievers of Mecca have [certainly] not believed in Muhammad (s).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said in the interpretation of Allah's saying (Qaf.): '(Qaf.) He says: it is an azure mountain overlooking this world, and the colour of the sky takes from it; Allah swore by it, (By the glorious Qur'an) and He swore by the glorious, noble Qur'an,
